goFlux 0.2.0
  • Reference

    Linear model for flux calculation

    LM.flux.Rd

    Estimates a gas flux with a linear regression, and then extracts values from the linear fit.

    LM.flux(gas.meas, time.meas, flux.term)

    Arguments

    gas.meas

    numerical vector containing gas measurements (ppm or ppb)

    time.meas

    numerical vector containing time stamps (seconds)

    flux.term

    numerical value; flux term calculated with the function flux.term

    Value

    Returns a data frame with 11 columns: linear flux estimate, initial gas concentration (LM.C0), final gas concentration (LM.Ct), slope of linear regression (LM.slope), mean absolute error (LM.MAE), root mean square error (LM.RMSE), Akaike information criterion corrected for small sample size (LM.AICc), standard error (LM.SE), relative standard error (LM.se.rel), r2 (LM.r2), and p-value (LM.p.val).

    Details

    Flux estimate units are µmol/m2s (if initial concentration is ppm, e.g. CO2dry_ppm) and nmol/m2s (if initial concentration is ppb, e.g. CH4dry_ppb).

    See also

    Look up the function flux.term of this package for more information about this parameter.

    See also the function HM.flux for information about the non-linear regression model used in this package.
